function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Mixed results in the relationship between moral support for measures and compliant behavior","Impact":"Uncertainty in understanding the factors influencing compliance and the development of effective policies.","Mitigation":"Further research and data collection to better understand the drivers of compliant behavior.","Technologies":"Data analytics and survey tools for gathering and analyzing behavioral data.","People":"Researchers, policymakers, and public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies, and public health organizations"},{"Description":"Perception of personal costs not influencing compliance","Impact":"Ineffective implementation of policies that rely on reducing personal costs to increase compliance.","Mitigation":"Consider alternative strategies and incentives to promote compliance, such as emphasizing the collective benefit of the measures.","Technologies":"Social and behavioral economics tools for designing effective incentive structures.","People":"Policymakers, economists, and behavioral scientists","Owner":"Government agencies, think tanks, and research institutions"},{"Description":"Negative emotions increasing compliance with stay-at-home measures","Impact":"Potential strain on mental health from prolonged negative emotions and isolation.","Mitigation":"Implementation of mental health support services and interventions to address the emotional impact of the measures.","Technologies":"Telemedicine platforms, mental health apps, and virtual support groups.","People":"Individuals subject to stay-at-home measures, mental health professionals","Owner":"Healthcare providers, mental health organizations, and community support groups"}]}
